instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 1 and A keys not working.
threads.message:
I've tried over 5 keyboards, new, old and it is always 1 and A key isn't working. J5713 connector looks very clean. can't see any corrosion inside the connector nor on the pins. <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> looks good as well. all other keys are working. 

i can't see any corrosion on the logic board.

any idea? bad <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 1 and A keys not working.
threads.message:
I don't have any idea how the matrix rows-columns is realized, but is very strange to have only 2 non-working keys.
Should be more keys affected, if one row, or column is bad.
Maybe some function keys (upper row of keyboard) are not working too.
In such case, you suspect a row, or column.
One key, or few only, is normal keyboard problem; individual keys issue.
Did you try PRAM reset, just in case?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 1 and A keys not working.
threads.message: let me run some test, get back to you. no, I haven't try PRAM.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 1 and A keys not working.
threads.message: you are right, i thought Q and Z was working. now i tested 1, A, Q , Z,  f11, f12 doesn't work.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 1 and A keys not working.
threads.message: I'll do the continuity test from J5713 to <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> in first thing tomorrow.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 1 and A keys not working.
threads.message: fixed. 1 of the WS pin on J5713 had no resistance to anywhere at all, so I touched up all the pins on J5713 and <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> with fresh solder.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 1 and A keys not working.
threads.message: Be aware that <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> is a pretty princess and sometimes has intermittant failures. So this one may return, replace <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> if it does come back.
